segment.source: Create a single-shot timer
segment.target: Create a single-shot timer

segment.source: Use the CreateTimer method to create a timer for the work item.
segment.target: Use the CreateTimer method to create a timer for the work item.

segment.source: Supply a lambda that accomplishes the work, and use the delay parameter to specify how long the thread pool waits before it can assign the work item to an available thread.
segment.target: Supply a lambda that accomplishes the work, and use the delay parameter to specify how long the thread pool waits before it can assign the work item to an available thread.

segment.source: The delay is specified using a TimeSpan structure.
segment.target: The delay is specified using a TimeSpan structure.

segment.source: Note You can use CoreDispatcher.RunAsync to access the UI and show progress from the work item.
segment.target: Note You can use CoreDispatcher.RunAsync to access the UI and show progress from the work item.

segment.source: If the timer is still counting down, but the work item is no longer needed, call Cancel.
segment.target: If the timer is still counting down, but the work item is no longer needed, call Cancel.

segment.source: The timer is cancelled and the work item won't be submitted to the thread pool.

segment.source: Remarks
segment.target: Remarks

segment.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps can't use Thread.Sleep because it can block the UI thread.
segment.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps can't use Thread.Sleep because it can block the UI thread.

segment.source: You can use a ThreadPoolTimer to create a work item instead, and this will delay the task accomplished by the work item without blocking the UI thread.
segment.target: You can use a ThreadPoolTimer to create a work item instead, and this will delay the task accomplished by the work item without blocking the UI thread.

segment.source: See the thread pool sample for a complete code sample that demonstrates work items, timer work items, and periodic work items.
segment.target: See the thread pool sample for a complete code sample that demonstrates work items, timer work items, and periodic work items.

segment.source: The code sample was originally written for Windows 8.1 but the code can be re-used in Windows 10.
segment.target: The code sample was originally written for Windows 8.1 but the code can be re-used in Windows 10.
